title: Indestructible. Cat story below.
author: Amythyst
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2025
review_text: I bought these for ease of use, and because I was looking for something to hold heavier, larger picture frames in my gallery wall more efficiently, as I’m lazy and wanted minimal damage to the walls. I tested these by using a 15lb claw on a medium sized picture frame with glass, above my nightstand. My 3 year old one-brain-celled cat, Nugget, has absolute BEEF with this photo for some reason (my working theory is that he finds the painting of the white cat in the photo either alluring or unsettling). Every. Single. Day. Without fail. Multiple times a day. He is able to stand up on his hind feet to hook his claws between the frame and the glass, and pull the frame OUT FROM THE WALL, at a 45 degree angle, meowing like he’s possessed by a demon (but in the tiniest, cutest voice imaginable, his little voice sounds like an angel singing hallelujah???) which makes the contrast of his roaring at my photo very startling. He has NEVER managed to pull it down, these claws have been tested by Nugget’s claws, and they HOLD UP. 10/10 will be buying these again for every picture I need to hang. Cat tax of my orange idiot below, and the photo he loves/hates.
product_title: 3M CLAW 15, 25 and 45 lb. Drywall Picture Hanger Variety Pack With Spot Markers, Heavyweight Hanging Solution for Room Decor and Office Decor, Including Mirrors or Large Art – 8 Pack

title: Questionable long term holding power
author: A
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2025
review_text: I bought these hanging claws to hang up a cool art piece I picked up while thrifting. It isn’t really heavy, but the backing is metal, so I weighed the wall art to see which claw to use. My art piece is a little over 5 lbs. For some reason I was hesitant to use the 15 lbs claws so I used two of the 25 claws instead. I liked the convenience of just pressing into the wall, but you have to push SO, SO hard to actually get it in the wall. I’m in decent shape and I even had to stop and shake my wrists and really push with my whole body weight to get them in. All this to say, the convenience of push and hang is nice, but these are not for someone with muscle weakness or maybe even arthritis. I am a bit concerned how this will hold up long term. Once installed, the claw was flush with the wall, but after I hung my art I peaked behind the woven art and it seems to me that the claw is ever so slightly forward now and no longer completely flush. I understand that my art kinda juts out a smidge, but considering that it weights a little over 5 lbs and I used two 25 lb claws, I’m just concerned this won’t be a long term solution.
product_title: 3M CLAW 15, 25 and 45 lb. Drywall Picture Hanger Variety Pack With Spot Markers, Heavyweight Hanging Solution for Room Decor and Office Decor, Including Mirrors or Large Art – 8 Pack

title: Renter Necessity
author: sam
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
review_text:
If you’re renting - or even if you just don’t want to throw nails in your walls at home - these are a necessity. I’ve been a ride or die command strip supporter for decades now, but our current apartment hates them. As in, the paint absolutely sucks and is just so low quality that the command strips don’t always last long. Plus, we have neighbors that literally shake the walls and have multiple instances of flooding through the ceiling, both of which aren’t command-strip friendly.

We started using these and are basically switching to them for everything. The cleanup after removal is way more discrete than command strips, because with these youll have a couple of teeny tiny holes to fill in. With the command strips, if they don’t come off cleanly, you have to either cover missing paint or a deep chunk of missing drywall.

We’ve hung up stuffed animal baskets with these, lightweight signs, heavy signs and lights, a coffee mug rack, and I trust them for use up high on walls or over other fixtures and furniture. These books are also incredibly easy to install, if anything you’ll just need something with some weight (hammer, can of soup, a shoe…) to help drive the hook into the wall, but it’s very quick and I think most anybody with some upper body ability would be able to handle it themselves. Removal is a little trickier, you’ll need something to wedge under the hook to pop it out, but it takes seconds, and the hook is completely reusable.
product_title: 3M CLAW 15, 25 and 45 lb. Drywall Picture Hanger Variety Pack With Spot Markers, Heavyweight Hanging Solution for Room Decor and Office Decor, Including Mirrors or Large Art – 8 Pack

review_text: This thing just bends when you try to install it. I tried three of them, and they all just twisted. I wasted my time and money trying to use this product. Don’t make the same mistake. In the end, I had to go with a much cheaper screw. It took much less time, too.

title: Clever & stress free!
author: yattzilla
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
review_text:
I was a bit skeptical about this product, and bought the starter pack so I had all the weight options for my heavier (~20lb) glass framed print.

After watching some videos, I decided to use the 45lb hook and it was SO easy to install! I have drywall/plaster coated walls, so it took a bit of hammering to get it flush. The print is quite secure. The little markers that come included are amazing to help with placement.

title: Better than screws or nails!
author: James R.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
review_text: The 3M CLAW system works way better than I expected! This is the new way to hang things on drywall - I'm using them for various-sized framed portraits. Even the smallest CLAW can support up to 15 pounds; I've had one holding a 12-pound frame and after checking on the condition of the CLAW after a few months, it is still rock solid, with no sag like a typical nail or screw will have when being pulled down constantly by weight. I've even used a few of them in softer wood with no issues so far. Very well made product, worth every penny, 5-stars from me!
product_title: 3M CLAW 15, 25 and 45 lb. Drywall Picture Hanger Variety Pack With Spot Markers, Heavyweight Hanging Solution for Room Decor and Office Decor, Including Mirrors or Large Art – 8 Pack

title: Works extremely well!
author: Ann
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2024
review_text:
I recently moved and needed to hang some frames on the walls.
I didn't want to hammer in nails because I hate the gaping holes they leave. And I've smashed my fingers with a hammer too many times to count.

I was seriously considering hiring someone to come and hang my frames for me.
But I came across these and decided to buy them. I could always return them if it didn't work out.

These work AMAZINGLY. Super easy to push into the wall and surprisingly very sturdy and secure.
I've pretty much used up the sampler pack I bought and will be purchasing more once I figure out where to place my remaining frames.
product_title: 3M CLAW 15, 25 and 45 lb. Drywall Picture Hanger Variety Pack With Spot Markers, Heavyweight Hanging Solution for Room Decor and Office Decor, Including Mirrors or Large Art – 8 Pack

date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2024
review_text:

I wish I had these when hanging some pictures and art and didn't have to use drywall anchors.
